timeline.bodyText: shouldn't participantId be a foreign key?
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: participantId can not be a foreign key in Response Server. This value is coming from Mobile during [POST] /participant/update-activity-state api endpoint.
replies.author: monica-BTC

timeline.bodyText: if token needs to be unique, please add the unique annotation to it and see if that generates the index. If hibernate/SQL creates the index already (as I think MySQL would), then that is the preferred approach.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Removed unique from participant_info_token_identifier_idx as discussed with the team. Token identifier may not be unique. It is a hashed version of a user's enrollment token. There is no requirement that the enrollment token is unique across studies. This means that if there is a possibility that the token is not unique
replies.author: monica-BTC

timeline.bodyText:
since the token is not unique, most likely your query includes more than just the token_identifier; so it is possible that a composite index might be a better solution.
Please document the query you need this index for so that I can verify if this is the appropriate index for it.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: looks good, thanks for the fix.
